title: Costa Rica at the Paralympics
text:
<a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a> made its <a href="Paralympic%20Games">Paralympic Games</a> début at the <a href="1992%20Summer%20Paralympics">1992 Summer Paralympics</a> in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, sending just two representatives to compete in men's <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%201992%20Summer%20Paralympics">track and field</a>. Absent in 1996, it returned in 2000, and has participated in every edition of the <a href="Summer%20Paralympics">Summer Paralympics</a> since then. Its delegations have always been small: a single athlete in track and field in 2000; a single swimmer in 2004; two table tennis players in 2008, a single athlete in track and field and a cyclist on 2012.
<a href="Sherman%20Guity">Sherman Guity</a> is the first medalist for Costa Rica at the Paralympics. He won the silver medal in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20100%20metres%20T64">men's 100 metres T64</a> event at the <a href="2020%20Summer%20Paralympics">2020 Summer Paralympics</a> held in Tokyo, Japan. A few days later, he also won the gold medal in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20200%20metres%20T64">men's 200 metres T64</a> event.
Costa Rica has never taken part in the Winter Paralympics.
